direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods add HTML content to the element, but prepend adds it at the start while append adds it at the end.
Both methods insert nodes at the start of the element's children, but prependChild inserts a single node while prepend inserts parsed HTML content.
Both methods insert multiple nodes at the start of the element's children, but prependChildren inserts a collection of nodes while prepend inserts parsed HTML content.
Both methods can be used to add content to an element, but prepend adds content at the start while append adds it at the end.
Both methods insert children at a specified position, but prepend inserts at the start (index 0) while insertChildren allows specifying any index.
Both methods add text content to the element, but prependText adds it at the start while appendText adds it at the end.
Both methods add text content at the start of the element's children.
Both methods add new elements to the element, but prependElement adds it at the start while appendElement adds it at the end.
Both methods add new elements at the start of the element's children.
